page.title: 12Clubs in The Shelsleys
page.content: { Shelsley Social Club}draws members from a large area. There is a bar and various amenities in the village hall. {The Shelsley Women's Institute}meets in the village hall each month. They are affiliated to the National Federation of W.I.s and to the Associated Country Women of the World. There is a small{Bible study group who meet in each others' houses for study and discussions. The{Shelsley Songsters}are children who meet at the Schoolhouse, now a private dwelling, to learn to sing and to give concerts in the village hall. The{bellringers}meet for practice and ring for services. The ringers come from several of the local churches and ring in the different churches each week. The Shelsleys do not have a full band of ringers.
